scenarioDescription:
The HR 858 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HR 858 is a star with 1.15 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.31 times its radius. It is located 104.25 light years away from the solar system.

HR 858 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HR 858 system


HR 858 b

HR 858 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2019-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 858 b is 4.993 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 858 b is 2.085 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.03, and a semi-major axis of 0.048 astronomical units, HR 858 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


HR 858 c

HR 858 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2019-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 858 c is 4.420 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 858 c is 1.939 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.33, and a semi-major axis of 0.0674 astronomical units, HR 858 c could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


HR 858 d

HR 858 d was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2019-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 858 d is 5.342 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 858 d is 2.164 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HR 858 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HR 858, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HR 858 - System With 3 Exoplanets
